column2: ARKANSAS DMV PERMIT TEST
column4: Arkansas

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. If you hear a thumping sound while driving, you should:
column4: get off the road and check your tires.
column8: hook your shoe under the gas pedal and see if you can free it.

column2: 2. Are bicyclists required to obey traffic laws and signs?
column4: Yes, but only if they are riding in a bicycle lane.
column6: No, bicyclists are considered pedestrians when it comes to the rules of the road.
column8: Yes.

column2: 3. If your car becomes disabled on a highway, you should:
column4: stop where you are.
column8: park with all four wheels off the highway, if possible.

column2: 4. When driving in rainy weather, you should:
column4: steer off the road.
column8: steer and brake smoothly.

column2: 5. In 55 MPH traffic you are least likely to be involved in a collision if you:
column4: drive a few MPH slower than most.
column8: drive a few MPH faster than most.

column2: 6. Drivers who have been drinking are more likely to:
column4: keep a safe following distance.
column8: be less reactive.

column2: 7. When taking medication while driving, you should:
column4: drive 20 MPH below the posted speed limit.
column6: consult your physicians and/or pharmacist regarding any prescription medication and its possible effects on driving.
column8: follow other vehicles closely.

column2: 8. This road sign means:
column4: Turn left at the intersection
column8: Lane shifting

column2: 9. A curb painted red means:
column4: No parking or stopping
column6: Reserved for passengers pick up or drop off
column8: Parking is for disabled persons with a special placard or plate.

column2: 10. When a pedestrian is crossing a street guided carrying a white cane, drivers must:
column4: always yield the right-of-way.
column6: yield the right of way at corners only.
column8: help the pedestrian cross the street.

column2: 11. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.
column6: left turns are not allowed at the intersection.
column8: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.

column2: 12. When driving in snow, you should:
column4: make speed and directional changes more gradually.
column6: slowly increase your speed for better traction.
column8: use your cruise control if possible.

column2: 13. This road sign means:
column4: A road joins from the right
column6: All traffic must go straight ahead
column8: All traffic must turn right

column2: 14. Don't be afraid to sound a sharp blast on your horn when:
column4: another vehicle is in danger of hitting you.
column6: when a child is about to run into the street.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 15. You are approaching an intersection with a traffic signal indicating a steady yellow light. If you have not already entered the intersection, you should:
column4: slow down and proceed with caution through the intersection.
column6: speed up to cross the intersection before the light turns red.
column8: stop before entering the intersection if it is safe to do so.

column2: 16. This sign warns drivers of:
column4: a dip in the road. Drivers should be ready to stop if the dip is filled with water.
column8: a bridge ahead, wide enough to accommodate two lanes of traffic, but with very little clearance.

column2: 17. This road sign means:
column4: School crossing
column8: School zone

column2: 18. When approaching an intersection with a traffic control signal that is not working, drivers should:
column4: speed up and proceed through the intersection.
column6: try not to stop if the intersection is clear.
column8: stop as you would if there were stop signs in all directions, yield the right-of-way, then enter the intersection.

column2: 19. Regulatory signs are:
column4: Warnings
column8: Law

column2: 20. A defensive driver:
column4: never drives below the speed limit.
column6: knows when it is safe to pass other vehicles.
column8: considers what other drivers might do and is always prepared to act.

column2: 21. This road sign means:
column4: Stop sign ahead
column8: Reduction in lanes

column2: 22. The best way to deal with tailgaters is to:
column4: let them pass if it's safe to do so.
column8: always keep your eyes focused ahead of your car.

column2: 23. When driving in heavy rain, drivers should use:
column4: high beam headlights.
column8: parking lights.

column2: 24. This road sign means:
column4: Four-lane traffic ahead
column8: Two-way traffic ahead

column2: 25. This sign means:
column4: The driver is near a school and should watch for children.
column6: Business area nearby. Watch for business people.
column8: There is a work zone ahead. Watch for workers.
